title: evil
comment: The presence of corruption, malevolence and depravity in the world, opposed to God's nature and will. Scripture stresses that evil is a force in its own right, rather than the mere absence of good, and describes its origins and the manner in which God deals with its continuing presence and power in his world.

children.title: evil, origins of
children.comment: Although Scripture does not reveal the ultimate origin of evil, it identifies a number of intermediate sources.

children.title: Satan as a source of evil

seealsos.comment: Satan incites David to take a census of Israel
Satan is responsible for a woman's crippling disease
The devil prompts Judas to betray Jesus Christ
Ananias lies to the Holy Spirit at Satan's instigation
Paul's thorn in the flesh from Satan

children.title: Fallen human nature as a source of evil

seealsos.comment: the love of money a root of evil
The tongue is a source of evil

children.title: Physical evil is a consequence of moral evil
evil, warnings against
children.comment: Scripture repeatedly warns against evil. It exposes it and reveals its consequences.

children.title: God's law given to counter evil
By leading believers away from evil
The state is ordained to restrain evil
evil, believers' responses to
children.comment: Scripture outlines several ways in which believers should respond to evil.

children.title: Evil is to be repaid with good
Believers should pray in response to evil
Believers should trust God in the face of evil
evil, victory over
children.comment: Although evil continues to be present and active in the world, Scripture gives an assurance that God will finally triumph over evil in all its forms.

children.title: Satan's power is already limited by God
Evil spirits are subject to God's control
Jesus Christ's triumph over evil powers
God's transforming power reverses the effects of evil in human lives
God brings good out of evil
The removal of the curse on creation
Jesus Christ's victory over evil is expressed in his thousand-year reign with believers, during which Satan is bound

seealsos.comment: Interpreters differ over whether the ``thousand years'' refers to a future period or to Jesus Christ's present rule in the world.

children.title: The final defeat of all evil powers
Evil will be excluded from the new heaven and earth
evil, examples of
children.comment: Biblical examples of evil are many and varied.

children.title: Evil disasters sent by God in judgment
Threats to Israel from other nations
